H2720.def: = state in which food is free from moisture or liquid

H7962.def: = state in which humans live without fear or concerns, which is either or not appropriate depending on the situation

H1004.def: = construction surrounded by walls and covered with a roof; ◄ normally made of stones, wood, or clay; ► to be used as living quarters, for storage, as a prison, as a sanctuary, etc.; sometimes used to denote a smaller part of a large construction

H4392.def: = state in which a certain location, container, or surface is filled or covered with so many objects that little or no space is left

H2077.def: = the human activity of killing one or more animals as a religious sacrifice; usually part of the animal is offered to the deity and the other part is eaten by the worshipers; often accompanied by the burning of incense

H7379.def: = state of opposition or hostility between two or more persons, perhaps even involving a deity

H7919.def: = state in which humans are able to accomplish whatever they attempt to do

H5650.def: = man who is under the authority of someone else as that person's legal property, employee, subject, or vassal; or someone who presents himself as such when speaking to someone of importance or praying to God

H4910.def: = state in which humans are similar in shape, behavior or experience to others

H954.def: = state in which someone has forfeited the respect of the community, due to a situation that is not in accordance to someone's status

H2505.def: = causative action by which humans or deities divide an object (or range of objects) into portions; ► usually with the intention to use one or more of these portions for a particular purpose

H5159.def: = process by which possessions are transferred from one generation to the next

H251.def: = son of one's father, whether from the same mother or not

H4715.def: = a container, ◄ made of hardened clay, ► used for the smelting of ore; ≈ associated with times of testing and trial

H3701.def: = silver, usually in the form of small unstamped pieces that had to be weighed in order to determine their value; after the exile, people in Israel started using coins

H3564.def: = a construction ◄ made of hardened clay or of bricks ► and used for the smelting of ore or the firing of ceramic ware; ≈ often used figuratively to denote a prolonged period of hardship; also associated with times of testing and trial

H2091.def: = metal of a bright yellow color, ◄ found in rocks and alluvial deposits ► and used as a monetary standard and in jewellery and plating; ≈ associated with wealth, beauty, and prosperity

H3068.def: = deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses

H974.def: = action by which humans or deities examine the character of other humans or deities by having them engage in a certain activity, ◄ as a goldsmith tests the quality of a precious metal by smelting it in the fire

H3826.def: literally: heart; hence: = the seat of knowledge, human reasoning, planning, intelligence, skill, affection and hatred, desire and satisfaction, humility and pride, courage and fear, joy and grief

H7489.def: literally: to make (one's deeds) wrong; hence: = action by which humans behave in an evil or harmful way

H7181.def: = action by which humans or deities pay close attention in order to be able to hear what (other) humans might be saying, or to pick up other sounds and react to if needed

H8267.def: = state in which humans are not committed towards fulfilling their obligations and show that by their actions

H238.def: = to make an effort to hear the words spoken by someone else

H1942.def: = state of experiencing an urge to see something happen or do something oneself; ◄ usually evil

H3956.def: = the fleshy organ in the mouth, used for tasting, licking, swallowing, and (in the case of humans) speaking

H3932.def: only used in poetry; = action by which humans or deities express their disdain of others with words, sounds and/or gestures

H7326.def: = state in which an animal lacks what is essential for its normal needs

H2778.def: = causative action by which humans make an effort to arouse an emotion of shame in (other) humans or deities; ◄ by their words or actions

H6213.def: = causative action by which human or deities produce an object, either personally or by others on behalf of them

H8056.def: = state in which humans feel and show great joy

H343.def: = extremely difficult circumstances ► resulting in grief, poverty, sickness, and/or death

H5352.def: literally: to be cleaned out; hence: = causative action by which a city is deprived of its inhabitants

H5850.def: = circular or semi-circular ornamental headdress, ◄ usually made out of precious metals and decorated with jewels, ► worn by kings, priests, and officials as a symbol of authority and status; also given to women by their suitors to win their affection

H2205.def: = state in which a human being is nearing the end of a long life

H1.def: = direct male progenitor; ► who normally provides protection, care, instruction, and discipline; ≈ is usually regarded with respect and associated with wisdom, security, and comfort

H3499.def: = what remains in existence after part of the original quantity has disappeared or has been used or dealt with in a certain way; used for humans, animals, plants, and inanimate objects

H5000.def: = state in which humans or parts of their body are considered physically attractive

H5036.def: = foolish person who has no respect for God or his fellow human beings but thinks highly of himself

H637.def: = the two external openings in the nose

H8267.def: = state in which humans are not committed towards fulfilling their obligations and show that by their actions

H5081.def: = state in which humans are willing to perform a certain task and show that by their actions

H7810.def: = an object, usually of some value, given to a person; ► can be given without any expectation of exchange or often with the purpose to influence or persuade another person

H2580.def: = state in which someone or something is physically attractive; ► which may bring about a favorable attitude in others

H68.def: = hard, heavy, and strong substance, ◄ very commonly found in nature,  ► which can be hewn into different shapes by a craftsman

H1167.def: = person exercising authority over people, animals, or inanimate objects in the role of owner, ruler, or husband

H834.def: = a linker introducing a proposition that gives additional information regarding an explicit or implicit object, location, time, or manner

H6437.def: = action by which humans or animals turn their body to face a direction different from the one they were facing before

H7919.def: = state in which humans are able to accomplish whatever they attempt to do

H3680.def: = state or process by which a surface is covered by another object, ► often making this surface more or less invisible

H6588.def: = action by which humans or groups defy an authority or a standard of behavior; by extension, can also refer to the punishment or guilt incurred from a trangression

H1245.def: = action by which deities, humans, or animals make an intensive effort to locate (other) humans, animals, objects, or activities, which often requires them to move from one location to another

H160.def: = affection between people, or between people and deities

H6504.def: = process by which an object is split up into smaller units

H441.def: = person in a position of leadership over a tribe or clan

H1606.def: = action by which humans or deities speak to animals, humans, deities, or natural objects in anger, in order to express their displeasure and cause them to change their behavior

H5181.def: = action by which humans or supernatural beings move down from a place of higher elevation

H995.def: = state in which someone has the ability to see through the outward appearance of things and grasp their essence

H3967.def: = state in which a countable entity is one hundred in number

H3684.def: = state of absence of wisdom, which manifests itself in excessive anger, talking too rashly and too much, sinful behavior, and laziness, ► and results in poverty, shame, punishment, and trouble and grief for other people; ≈ foolishness is thought to reside in a person's {L:heart<SDBH:לֵב>}; the behavior and treatment of fools is often compared to that of animals

H1245.def: = action by which deities, humans, or animals make an intensive effort to locate (other) humans, animals, objects, or activities, which often requires them to move from one location to another

H389.def: = particle marking a constituent as representing a limited number of entities

H4805.def: = action by which humans reject the authority of someone to which they had formerly been subjected

H394.def: = pertaining to being without mercy towards humans and animals

H4397.def: = a human or supernatural being who carries a message on behalf of someone else

H7971.def: = causative action by which humans or deities commission one or more agents to go to a certain individual or place in order to perform a certain task

H6298.def: = process by which humans, animals, or deities come upon other humans or animals while travelling from one location to another, either or not expectedly; these encounters may be peaceful or result in aggression depending on the nature or intentions of one or both parties

H1677.def: = large mammal with thick fur and a rather doglike face; walks on all fours but may stand up on its back legs to get a better view; maybe 2 meters tall when standing up and weigh over 200 kilos; feeds on roots, berries, wild fruit, mice, and lizards, and, occasionally, small livestock; ◄ |iUrsus arctos syriacus|i*; ► dangerous when provoked or robbed of cubs; ≈ associated with violence and danger

H7909.def: = state in which humans or animals have lost one or more of their offspring

H3684.def: = state of absence of wisdom, which manifests itself in excessive anger, talking too rashly and too much, sinful behavior, and laziness, ► and results in poverty, shame, punishment, and trouble and grief for other people; ≈ foolishness is thought to reside in a person's {L:heart<SDBH:לֵב>}; the behavior and treatment of fools is often compared to that of animals

H200.def: = state of being regarded as foolish, ◄  because of lack of fear of God, unwillingness to listen to advice, talking too much, and being unable to conceal one's temper

H7725.def: = action by which humans face a direction different from the one they were facing before

H4185.def: = process why which an object gets detached from the place where it has been fixed

H1004.def: = construction surrounded by walls and covered with a roof; ◄ normally made of stones, wood, or clay; ► to be used as living quarters, for storage, as a prison, as a sanctuary, etc.; sometimes used to denote a smaller part of a large construction

H7225.def: = point in time at which an event starts happening

H4066.def: = state of opposition or hostility between two or more persons

H6362.def: = state in which humans have been released from a certain task or duty

H4325.def: = water as the indispensible liquid on which the existence of all life depends, used for drinking, preparing food, washing, irrigating, etc.; found under the earth, on the earth, and above the earth; sometimes used as a euphemism to denote certain body liquids; ≈ associated with abundance and refreshment, but also with instability, and danger, etc.

H5203.def: = process by which ropes that used to be tightly strung begin to hang loose

H7379.def: = state of opposition or hostility between two or more persons, perhaps even involving a deity

H1566.def: = meaning unsure; possibly: = process by which humans suddenly become very angry and get engaged in a conflict

H6663.def: = state or process by which humans and deities are found to conform to an accepted code of behavior

H7563.def: = state in which a person's behavior is inconsistent with the requirements of the law, either in a specific matter that is under dispute or as one's general mode of behavior

H7561.def: = state in which humans are or are considered to be in a state of guilt before God or humans, ◄ as a result of (allegedly) having acted in a way that is contrary to the law

H6662.def: = state in which a person's or deity's behavior is fully consistent with the requirements of the law, either in a specific matter that is under dispute or as one's general mode of behavior

H8147.def: = state in which a countable entity is two in number

H8441.def: = state in which an event is considered utterly wrong and detestable

H3068.def: = deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses

H1571.def: marker pointing to information that needs to be considered in addition to previous information (either explicit or implied)

H4100.def: = a reference to an unknown object or event; normally used with the purpose of identifying that object; sometimes used in rhetorical questions expressing one's conviction that that object or event cannot be identified

H3684.def: = state of absence of wisdom, which manifests itself in excessive anger, talking too rashly and too much, sinful behavior, and laziness, ► and results in poverty, shame, punishment, and trouble and grief for other people; ≈ foolishness is thought to reside in a person's {L:heart<SDBH:לֵב>}; the behavior and treatment of fools is often compared to that of animals

H4242.def: = the amount of money expected, required, or given in payment for something

H3027.def: = the lower part of the upper limb of the human body, which in some contexts may include the full arm, ► apart from basic human activities such as holding, giving and taking, working, beating, also used in rituals around blessings, oaths, and prayer; ≈ used figuratively in expressions involving strength, control, responsibility, punishment; ≈ possibly used as a euphemism for the male genitals

H369.def: = state in which an object or event is either absent or non-existant

H3820.def: = the organ located in the centre of the human body that pumps the blood through our circulatory system, ≈ seen as the seat of knowledge, human reasoning, planning, intelligence, skill, affection and hatred, desire and satisfaction, humility and pride, courage and fear, joy and grief

H7069.def: = action by which humans acquire an animate or inanimate object ◄ by means of a financial transaction or in another way

H2451.def: = state in which humans, deities or animals have a certain level of wisdom, intelligence, or proficiency

10.gl: to hold, carry, have (in one's luggage)

H7453.def: = the non-verbal sounds made by a large group of people in response to a situation, either positively or negatively

H157.def: = state in which humans or deities experience a feeling of affection for a person, an object, or a practice

H6256.def: = a shorter or longer moment in the passage of time

H251.def: = son of one's father, whether from the same mother or not

H6869.def: = a process by which humans go through extremely difficult circumstances, resulting in severe anxiety, ◄ as if one were confined to a narrow and cramped space from which there is no escape

H120.def: = human being as an individual or as a class of living creatures; sometimes explicitly subdivided between {L:male<SDBH:זָכָר>} and {L:female<SDBH:נְקֵבָה>}; ≈ associated with mortality

H2638.def: = state in which humans lack something that they are supposed to have

H3820.def: = the organ located in the centre of the human body that pumps the blood through our circulatory system, ≈ seen as the seat of knowledge, human reasoning, planning, intelligence, skill, affection and hatred, desire and satisfaction, humility and pride, courage and fear, joy and grief

H3709.def: = the inner part of the human {L:hand<SDBH:יָד>}, but with special focus on the activities performed with it, such as holding, covering, or lifting objects, leaning on a staff, clapping, etc.

H6148.def: = action by which humans or deities take responsibility for someone else, taking upon themselves that person's obligations or vouching for that person's security

H6161.def: = action by which humans take responsibility for someone else, taking upon themselves that person's obligations

H7453.def: = the non-verbal sounds made by a large group of people in response to a situation, either positively or negatively

H157.def: = state in which humans or deities experience a feeling of affection for a person, an object, or a practice

H6588.def: = action by which humans or groups defy an authority or a standard of behavior; by extension, can also refer to the punishment or guilt incurred from a trangression

H4683.def: = thin cracker-like bread made without yeast

H6607.def: literally: opening up of words; hence: = causative process by which deities make words easier to understand

H1361.def: = state in which a person or object is of great or more than average height; ≈ associated with status

H1245.def: = action by which deities, humans, or animals make an intensive effort to locate (other) humans, animals, objects, or activities, which often requires them to move from one location to another

H7667.def: = causative action or process by which humans or deities cause an object to be broken into two or more pieces; ≈ sometimes use figuratively to denote the sudden end of a certain condition or situation

H6141.def: literally: to be crooked (of a person); hence: = state in which  humans lack integrity in everything they think or do

H3820.def: = the organ located in the centre of the human body that pumps the blood through our circulatory system, ≈ seen as the seat of knowledge, human reasoning, planning, intelligence, skill, affection and hatred, desire and satisfaction, humility and pride, courage and fear, joy and grief

H4672.def: = process by which humans or animals discover the person, animal, object or location they were looking for

H3956.def: = the fleshy organ in the mouth, used for tasting, licking, swallowing, and (in the case of humans) speaking

H2015.def: = action by which humans turn their body around in order to face a different direction than before

H5307.def: = process by which humans, animals, or objects move from a higher level to a lower level, typically at a high speed and without control

H3684.def: = state of absence of wisdom, which manifests itself in excessive anger, talking too rashly and too much, sinful behavior, and laziness, ► and results in poverty, shame, punishment, and trouble and grief for other people; ≈ foolishness is thought to reside in a person's {L:heart<SDBH:לֵב>}; the behavior and treatment of fools is often compared to that of animals

H8424.def: = process by which humans experience sorrow and suffering

H1.def: = direct male progenitor; ► who normally provides protection, care, instruction, and discipline; ≈ is usually regarded with respect and associated with wisdom, security, and comfort

H5036.def: = foolish person who has no respect for God or his fellow human beings but thinks highly of himself

H8055.def: = state in which humans and deities feel and show great joy

H8056.def: = state in which humans feel and show great joy

H3820.def: = the organ located in the centre of the human body that pumps the blood through our circulatory system, ≈ seen as the seat of knowledge, human reasoning, planning, intelligence, skill, affection and hatred, desire and satisfaction, humility and pride, courage and fear, joy and grief

H3190.def: = causative action by which humans cause objects to be in a better state of maintenance than before

H1456.def: = state in which someone enjoys a good health

H7307.def: = an invisible being that is in a direct relation to and under control of God and one of his manifestation, often described as a substance that can be poured out, ► through whom the universe is created and animated; it can manifest itself as an invisible force equipping humans with wisdom, skill, and strength for specific tasks; it can also manifest itself as a movement of air through the bodies of animate creatures (breath) or through nature (wind)

H3001.def: = process by which objects containing liquid essential to their existence lose these liquids ◄ due to some external or internal cause

H1634.def: = any of the pieces of hard, whitish tissue that together constitute the skeleton of humans and animals; ≈ associated with strength

H7563.def: = state in which a person's behavior is inconsistent with the requirements of the law, either in a specific matter that is under dispute or as one's general mode of behavior

H2436.def: = front of the body of a human being, which, when a person is sitting down, forms a kind of platform that can be used for activities like throwing the lot, and that can even function as a sitting place for someone else, like a pet animal, a child or a beloved one; ≈ symbolizes affection and intimacy, and sometimes represents the entire person

H7810.def: = an object, usually of some value, given to a person; ► can be given without any expectation of exchange or often with the purpose to influence or persuade another person

H5186.def: = state in which a relatively straight object is shaped into a curve

H734.def: = relatively narrow {L:road<SDBH:דֶּרֶךְ>} that connects two locations and facilitates travelling

H4941.def: = a situation where one party has a dispute with another party, and is looking for a legal ruling in which they receive what they consider to be rightfully theirs

H2451.def: = state in which humans, deities or animals have a certain level of wisdom, intelligence, or proficiency

H854.def: exact meaning unknown; possibly: = wooden handle with an iron head that has both an adze and a chisel as its ends; ► used for breaking up moderately hard soil to make it ready for cultivation

H995.def: = state in which someone has the ability to see through the outward appearance of things and grasp their essence

H3684.def: = state of absence of wisdom, which manifests itself in excessive anger, talking too rashly and too much, sinful behavior, and laziness, ► and results in poverty, shame, punishment, and trouble and grief for other people; ≈ foolishness is thought to reside in a person's {L:heart<SDBH:לֵב>}; the behavior and treatment of fools is often compared to that of animals

H776.def: = the earth as opposed to the sky; sometimes used in a more specific sense to denote part of the earth, such as the dry land as opposed to the sea, or a specific region, area, country, or plot of land

H3684.def: = state of absence of wisdom, which manifests itself in excessive anger, talking too rashly and too much, sinful behavior, and laziness, ► and results in poverty, shame, punishment, and trouble and grief for other people; ≈ foolishness is thought to reside in a person's {L:heart<SDBH:לֵב>}; the behavior and treatment of fools is often compared to that of animals

H3708.def: = state in which human experience displeasure, which is said to reside in their {L:heart<SDBH:לֵב>} ◄ and is caused by their own condition or by someone else

H1.def: = direct male progenitor; ► who normally provides protection, care, instruction, and discipline; ≈ is usually regarded with respect and associated with wisdom, security, and comfort

H4470.def: literally: bitterness; hence: = state in which humans are experiencing emotions of anger, resentment, and grief

H1571.def: marker pointing to information that needs to be considered in addition to previous information (either explicit or implied)

H6064.def: = causative action by which someone in authority forces humans to pay a certain amount in monetary value or in kind, ► usually as retribution for a certain offense

H6662.def: = state in which a person's or deity's behavior is fully consistent with the requirements of the law, either in a specific matter that is under dispute or as one's general mode of behavior

H5081.def: = state in which humans are willing to perform a certain task and show that by their actions

H3476.def: = state in which humans are morally and ethically right

H3045.def: = process by which humans or deities acquire information about other humans, deities, or certain facts, which is stored in the mind

H1847.def: = process by which humans or deities acquire information about other humans, deities, or certain facts, which is stored in the mind

H2820.def: = causative action by which human or deities keep something to themselves, refusing to give it to someone else

H561.def: = words spoken by humans and deities; often remembered and recorded

H8394.def: = state in which someone has the ability to see through the outward appearance of things and grasp their essence

H7119.def: = state in which water has a relatively low temperature

H7307.def: = an invisible being that is in a direct relation to and under control of God and one of his manifestation, often described as a substance that can be poured out, ► through whom the universe is created and animated; it can manifest itself as an invisible force equipping humans with wisdom, skill, and strength for specific tasks; it can also manifest itself as a movement of air through the bodies of animate creatures (breath) or through nature (wind)

H1571.def: marker pointing to information that needs to be considered in addition to previous information (either explicit or implied)

H191.def: = pertaining to being foolish, which manifests itself in a lack of fear of God, unwillingness to listen to advice, much talking, and being unable to conceal one's emotions

H2803.def: = action by which humans exercise their {L:mind<SDBH:לֵב>} with regard to something

H2450.def: = state in which humans, deities or animals have a certain level of wisdom, intelligence, or proficiency

H2790.def: = causative action by which someone makes incised marks on a surface of wood or stone with the help of a sharp and hard tool

H995.def: = state in which someone has the ability to see through the outward appearance of things and grasp their essence

H331.def: exact meaning unsure; probably: = state of being covered by a structure or pattern consisting of strips crossing each other with square or diamond-shaped spaces left between
